pain_points_original.title: Ensuring Data Security & Privacy Compliance
pain_points_original.description: The buyer must ensure any AI solution strictly complies with government ICT, security, and privacy policies (IPPs). Protecting sensitive government data, especially when using third-party LLMs, is a critical, non-negotiable requirement.

pain_points_original.title: Mitigating High-Risk Technology Integration
pain_points_original.description: The buyer is concerned about the difficulty, cost, and risk of integrating new AI solutions with existing government systems. They need to assess the adaptability and scalability of vendor solutions to avoid failed or disruptive implementations.

pain_points_original.title: Addressing Core Operational Inefficiencies
pain_points_original.description: The buyer's fundamental goal is to use AI to boost efficiency, improve decision-making, and innovate service delivery. Current processes are seen as inadequate for meeting public satisfaction goals and achieving better community outcomes.

pain_points_original.title: Lack of Budget Clarity for AI Solutions
pain_points_original.description: The buyer cannot effectively plan or allocate budget for AI initiatives without understanding the cost models. They require indicative pricing to inform future procurement planning, build business cases, and secure funding.

pain_points_original.title: De-risking AI Adoption with Proven Use Cases
pain_points_original.description: The buyer is risk-averse and needs to validate the real-world effectiveness of AI in a government context. They seek evidence of successful deployments in similar public sectors and opportunities for low-risk pilot initiatives before committing.

pain_points_original.title: Overcoming Internal AI Skills and Resource Gaps
pain_points_original.description: The buyer recognizes a potential internal skills gap and is uncertain about the resources required for deployment. They need to understand staff training needs and infrastructure requirements to ensure successful adoption and support.

pain_points_original.title: Navigating the Unfamiliar AI Market Landscape
pain_points_original.description: The buyer has a significant knowledge gap about available AI tools and their relevance to government. This RFI aims to create a 'catalogue of offerings' to understand the market and inform future strategic project planning and procurement.
